content:
I'm fascinated by the work of A.M. Cassandre, a French artist who created some of the most iconic travel posters of the 20th century. His use of bold colors, geometric shapes, and dynamic compositions is simply stunning. I've been keeping an eye out for his posters, and I recently acquired a beautiful example of his work, a 1930s poster for the Normandie ocean liner. It's a real showstopper!

As for themes, I'm particularly drawn to travel posters that evoke a sense of adventure and exploration. There's something about the idea of embarking on a grand journey that really speaks to me. I've also been interested in collecting posters that feature iconic modes of transportation, like trains, ships, and airplanes. There's something about the romance of travel that I find captivating.

What about you? Do you have any favorite artists or themes that you're drawn to in your collecting?
